intro: Galium acrophyum, commonly known as the tall whitebed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium acrophyum is often found in the understory of forests and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance to pollinators.
